result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robin C. Anding is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robin C. Anding

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:00 Defendant Robin C. Anding in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.15CM61 and 15CM63 heard at this time. Froelich: guilty to Ct#1 in 15CM61 with minimun fine. Restitution of $8.59. Ct#2 dismiss. In 15M63 dismiss Ct#1 and Ct#2; but Ct#1 used for read in for restitution purposes of $39.99. In 14CM259 guilty to Ct#1 with minimum fine. Nelson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 15CM61 and count in 14CM259; Nelson stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates def. guilty to charge in 14CM259 and Ct#1 in 15CM61; dismisses Ct#2 in 15CM61 and Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 15CM63; Ct#1 will be read in for restitution purposes. Froelich and Nelson address sentencing. Court: orders $265.60 fine in 14CM259. orders $265.60 in 15CM61 along with restitution of $8.59 and $39.99. Def may do community service. Fines are do in 6 months.  Nelson requests expungment. Court grants expungment. Atty Froelich will prepare an amended complaint on 15CM61 citing 1 charge with no dismissal.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

8:59  This also includes 15CM63  and 15CM61 Defendant Robin C. Anding in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich requests more time for the defendant to get an assessment done.

4:10  Defendant Robin C. Anding in court via video conf with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Robin C. Anding in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to all counts  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
